The experimental group's results were compared to the control group.
The experimental group is exposed to the independent variable.

words.definition: Assigning participants to experimental and control groups by chance, minimizing preexisting differences between the groups.
sentences: Random assignment helps ensure groups are similar.
Researchers use random assignment in experiments.
Random assignment reduces bias in studies.

words.definition: A harmless pill, medicine, or procedure prescribed more for the psychological benefit to the patient than for any physiological effect.
sentences: The control group received a placebo.
The placebo had no active ingredients.
The patient felt better even with the placebo.

words.definition: A study in which neither the participants nor the researchers know which participants are receiving the treatment and which are receiving a placebo.
sentences: Double-blind studies help prevent bias.
The new drug was tested in a double-blind study.
Double-blind studies are considered the gold standard in research.

words.definition: A group of people that reviews research proposals to ensure they meet ethical guidelines.
sentences: All research involving humans must be approved by an ethics committee.
The ethics committee ensures participant safety.
The ethics committee reviewed the study protocol.

words.definition: Permission granted in the knowledge of the possible consequences, typically that which is given by a patient to a doctor for treatment with full knowledge of the possible risks and benefits.
sentences: Research participants must give informed consent.
Informed consent ensures people understand the risks.
Doctors explain procedures to get informed consent.

words.definition: A conversation with participants after an experiment or study, especially one that involved deception, to explain the true purpose of the study and address any concerns.
sentences: After the experiment, participants received a full debriefing.
Debriefing is an important ethical step in research.
The researcher conducted a debriefing session.

words.definition: The repetition of an experiment or observation in a scientific study to increase the reliability of the results.
sentences: Replication of studies helps confirm findings.
Scientists often attempt replication of important experiments.
Replication is key to scientific progress.

words.definition: A statistical analysis that combines the results of multiple scientific studies.
sentences: A meta-analysis can provide a stronger conclusion than a single study.
She conducted a meta-analysis of all studies on the topic.
Meta-analysis helps synthesize research findings.

words.definition: A research design that involves repeated observations of the same variables over long periods of time.
sentences: The longitudinal study followed participants for 20 years.
Longitudinal studies are good for studying development over time.
She is involved in a large longitudinal study.

words.definition: A type of observational study that analyzes data from a population, or a representative subset, at a specific point in time.
sentences: A cross-sectional study can compare different age groups at once.
Cross-sectional studies are quicker than longitudinal studies.
The research used a cross-sectional study design.

words.definition: An intensive investigation of a single individual, group, or event.
sentences: The psychologist published a case study of his patient.
Case studies provide detailed information but may not be generalizable.
She wrote a case study on a rare psychological condition.

words.definition: A method of gathering information from a sample of people, usually through questionnaires or interviews.
sentences: We conducted a survey to understand public opinion.
The survey asked about people's attitudes towards health.
She analyzed the results of the online survey.

words.definition: A set of printed or written questions with a choice of answers, devised for the purposes of a survey or statistical study.
sentences: Participants filled out a questionnaire about their habits.
The questionnaire had many multiple-choice questions.
She designed a new questionnaire for her research.

words.definition: A meeting of people face to face, especially for consultation.
sentences: The psychologist conducted an interview with the client.
She had a job interview yesterday.
The researcher conducted many interviews for her study.

words.definition: The systematic process of watching and recording behavior.
sentences: Researchers used naturalistic observation to study animal behavior.
Direct observation is a common research method.
The study involved careful observation of children's play.

words.definition: A research method involving observing subjects in their natural environment without manipulation.
sentences: Naturalistic observation is often used in animal studies.
She conducted naturalistic observation in a classroom setting.
Naturalistic observation provides real-world data.
